Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2011 03:36AM char123 wrote: Hello; I was diagnosed with lymphedema, It turned out my implant ruptured, Have severe CC and was infected.  If you have implants, run to the Dr and get them checked.  Good Luck!
Posts.Title: Looks like Lymphedma - Can It Be Cancer Recurrence? hope1 beacher4209

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2011 10:26AM char123 wrote: Dear Katie:  Go with what the voice in your head and the feeling in your heart says.  That way, it will be right for you..Best Wishes...
Posts.Title: Such heavy decisions... katiebug msphil

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2011 07:23PM char123 wrote: Hello Pet:  To make a long story short, yes have the rads.  10 years ago, I had a mastectomy and no rads, here we are 10 years later and it came back, same exact place, just under the skin. I was told if I were to be diagnosed today (instead of the original BC 10 years ago) They would do rads and I most likely would not of had the recurrance.  So again, yep do the rads....
Posts.Title: Rad after chemo post mastectomy (stg 1) Petrochick thenewme

Posts.Content: Jul 21, 2010 04:52PM char123 wrote: hello to everyone: I wasn't going to do this but here I am. Had first rad today...very scared and my nerves,  wow. This is a second Breast Cancer for me. 10 years ago had a mastectomy.  It has lived just under the skin for all these years..So Rads it is to the implant and the whole area for me.....Anyway, hopefully all goes well for all of us.
Posts.Title: July 2010 Rads Houndmommy BARYAN

Posts.Content: May 13, 2010 11:33AM char123 wrote: Hello to all:  I am not trying to scare anyone into anything, but here is my story.  9 years ago, yes 9, I had a mastectomy.  Clear margins and did not need rads.  Here we are today and I have a recurrance at the mastecomy scar site.  I am doing chemo and will have rads when finished.  Hope this answers any questions you may have..
